newsitem.title: USA: CBOT rice ends choppy session mixed, old crop up.
newsitem.headline: CBOT rice ends choppy session mixed, old crop up.

text.p: CBOT rice futures ended a choppy session mixed with new crop months up on increasing spot demand, traders said.
"At $11.00 to $11.20 (per cwt), demand is beginning to show up," a floor trader said. "We're finding good buying there and selling around $11.30."
Traders cited reports Costa Rica was tendering on April 30 for 26,500 tonnes optional origin long grain rough rice or 18,000 tonnes long grain milled rice.
Floor sources also noted Argentina has sold large quantities of rice and may not be able to sell much more.
"Argentina's been our number one competitor lately," a trader said. "When Brazil comes to them looking for rice, they may not have any left to sell."
Traders expected Thursday's USDA export sales report to show between 18,000 and 28,000 tonnes of rice sold.

New crop months closed lower but floor sources noted continued concerns wet weather in the U.S. south would delay rice plantings. "The window for optimal planting is coming under some pressure here," a floor source said.
Rice ended five cents per cwt higher to four cents lower with May up one at $11.27-1/2.
Volume was estimated by CBOT at 400 lots, compared with Tuesday's actual volume of 325 lots.
